Class Chessboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • hioa.android.chess.Chessboard

  • public class Chessboard
extends Object
    The backend representation of the chessboard
    Version:
    2013-11-23
    Author:
    Lars Sætaberget

        private volatile long mBlackTime

      • mBonusTime

        private long mBonusTime

      • mChangeClockColor

        private volatile boolean mChangeClockColor
        Used by the clock-thread to determine whether or not the clock should switch to the other color.

        The thread will unset this after changing color automatically

      • mChessboard

        private Chesspiece[][] mChessboard

      • mClockRunning

        private volatile boolean mClockRunning
        This is used to confirm that the clock thread is not running

      • mContext

        private Context mContext

      • mEnPassant

        private EnPassant mEnPassant

      • mMoveCount

        private int mMoveCount
        Used to count towards the 50-move rule

      • mMoving

        private volatile boolean mMoving
        The game will not end in a win by timeout while this is true.

        Used to prevent players from losing by timeout while the program is performing a decisive move.

      • mPause

        private volatile boolean mPause
        Used to pause the execution of the chessclock. The clock will continue as normal after this is reverted back to false.

        The difference between this and mMoving is that mMoving will be automatically set to false at the end of a move. While this will remain in whatever state it's left in until pauseClock() is called again

      • mPositionHashFactory

        protected PositionHashFactory mPositionHashFactory

      • mPromotionFlag

        private int mPromotionFlag

      • mRunningColor

        private volatile int mRunningColor
        Used to determine which color's clock is running in order to revalidate the clock if this variable does not equal the current player in ChessboardView

      • mStartTime

        private long mStartTime

      • mStopClock

        private volatile boolean mStopClock
        Used to stop the clock from running without triggering a win by timeout.

        This is used when the game should end by some other means.

      • mView

        protected ChessboardView mView

      • mWhiteTime

        private volatile long mWhiteTime

      • checkForGameEnd

        private int checkForGameEnd(int color)
        Checks for various game over scenarios and ends the game if it should end.
        Parameters:

        True if the clock is still running.

        (And thus has an active thread)

        Initializes a new chessboard filled with Chesspieces
        Returns:

      • getPawnOnColumn

        protected Chesspiece getPawnOnColumn(int color,
                         int column,
                         int legalRow,
                         int legalColumn)
        Finds the pawn on the provided row of the provided color that can move to the provided coordinates
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the pawn you want
        column - The column where the pawn is located
        legalRow - The row that must be a legal target for the pawn
        legalColumn - The column that must be a legal target for the pawn
        Returns:
        The pawn specified by the parameters

      • getPieceAt

        public Chesspiece getPieceAt(int row,
                    int column)
        Fetches the Chesspiece at the given position
        Parameters:
        row - The row to fetch the piece from
        column - The column to fetch the piece from
        Returns:
        The piece located at the provided position

      • getPieceByFlag

        private Chesspiece getPieceByFlag(int flag,
                        int color,
                        int row,
                        int column)
        Returns a Chesspiece of a certain type based on the flag provided.
        The piece is initialized with the parameters color, row and column.
        Parameters:
        flag - The flag which decides what piece to return
        color - The color of the new piece
        row - The row position of the new piece
        column - The column position of the new piece
        Returns:
        A chesspiece matching the parameters

      • getPieceOnColumn

        protected Chesspiece getPieceOnColumn(Chesspiece piece,
                          int column)
        Returns the chesspiece of the same class and color as the provided piece which is located on the provided column
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to compare to
        column - The column the piece you want is located on
        Returns:
        The first piece located on this column which matches the class and color of the provided piece

      • getPieceOnRow

        protected Chesspiece getPieceOnRow(Chesspiece piece,
                       int row)
        Returns the chesspiece of the same class and color as the provided piece which is located on the provided row
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to compare to
        row - The row the piece you want is located on
        Returns:
        The first piece located on this row which matches the class and color of the provided piece

        public long getTime(int color)

        private boolean hasLegalMoves(int color)
        Checks if the player controlling this color has at least 1 legal move
        Parameters:
        color - The color of pieces to check
        Returns:
        True if the player has at least 1 legal move

      • isInCheck

        private boolean isInCheck(int color)
        Checks if the player controlling this color is in check
        Parameters:
        color - The color of pieces to check
        Returns:
        True if the player is in check

      • kingInCheckAfter

        public boolean kingInCheckAfter(Chesspiece piece,
                       int row,
                       int column)
        This method checks if the provided move will result in the piece's color's king being in check
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to move
        row - The row to move to
        column - The column to move to
        Returns:
        True if the king ends up in check

      • move

        public void move(Chesspiece piece,
        int row,
        int column,
        int oldRow,
        int oldColumn)
        Moves the piece to the provided row and column.

        Note: This method does no error-checking and simply assumes that the move is legal

        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to move
        row - The piece's new row position
        column - The piece's new column position
        oldRow - The piece's old row position
        oldColumn - The piece's old column position

      • move

        public void move(Chesspiece piece,
        int row,
        int column,
        int oldRow,
        int oldColumn,
        boolean castle)
        Moves the piece to the provided row and column.

        Note: This method does no error-checking and simply assumes that the move is legal

        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to move
        row - The piece's new row position
        column - The piece's new column position
        oldRow - The piece's old row position
        oldColumn - The piece's old column position
        castle - True if this is a castle(clock should not switch colors)

      • otherPieceCanMoveTo

        protected Chesspiece otherPieceCanMoveTo(Chesspiece piece,
                             int row,
                             int column)
        Finds the first piece that can move to the provided row and column and is also of the same class and color as the provided piece
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to compare to
        row - The row that must be a legal target
        column - The column that must be a legal target
        Returns:
        The piece matching the provided piece which can also move the the provided row and column

      • pauseClock

        public void pauseClock(boolean pause)
        Pauses the execution of the clock until this method is called again with false
        Parameters:
        pause - True to pause the clock, false to unpause the clock

      • placeEnPassant

        public void placeEnPassant(EnPassant enPassant)
        Places the provided EnPassant onto the chessboard
        Parameters:
        enPassant -

      • revalidateClock

        public void revalidateClock()

      • setActivity

        public void setActivity(GameActivity activity)

      • setChessboardView

        public void setChessboardView(ChessboardView view)

      • setMoving

        public void setMoving(boolean moving)
        Set this to block the current player from losing from time out until the current next call to move() is completed
        Parameters:
        moving - Should probably only ever be set to true from outside this class

      • setPromotionFlag

        public void setPromotionFlag(int flag)
        Let the chessboard know that there will be a promotion during the next move.

        The flags are given as constants in this class.
        NO_PROMOTION probably shouldn't be used outside of this class.

        Parameters:
        flag - NO_PROMOTION, QUEEN, ROOK, BISHOP or KNIGHT

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int color,
           long time)

      • setTime

        public void setTime(long startTime,
           long bonusTime)
        Set the time for the clock to use.
        Parameters:
        startTime - Starting time in millis
        bonusTime - Bonus time gained after each move in millis

      • startClock

        private void startClock(long startTime)
        Starts the clock
        Parameters:
        startTime - The starting time for each player

      • stopClock

        public void stopClock()
        Stops the clock and eventually(up to 50ms delay) kills the thread

        Use clockRunning() to determine whether or not the clock is still running.

      • tileContains

        public int tileContains(int row,
               int column,
               boolean showEnPassant)
        Returns an int explaining what type of piece(if any) is in the given tile
        Parameters:
        row - The row to check
        column - The column to check
        showEnPassant - Use this flag to determine if you want EN_PASSANT to be a returnable value. If this is false EN_PASSANT will be returned as NO_PIECE
        Returns:
        NO_PIECE, EN_PASSANT, BLACK or WHITE as defined in Chesspiece
